thread.title: Sanders makes gains but still trails Clinton in poll
thread.title_full: Sanders makes gains but still trails Clinton in poll - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Sanders makes gains but still trails Clinton in poll
text:
Albert Cesare /AP Hillary Clinton, seen at the Alabama Semi-Annual Democratic Conference on Saturday, still leads the Democratic 2016 field with 45% support in a new poll. Presidential candidate Bernie Sanders saw a small bump in his popularity following last week’s inaugural 2016 Democratic debate, but is still running far behind Hillary Clinton nationally, a new poll released Monday showed.
The CNN/ORC poll out Monday found that Clinton still led the Democratic 2016 field with 45% support among registered Democrats and independents, compared to 29% for Sanders.
Vice President Biden, who still hasn’t decided on a run, got 18% in the poll — the first taken after last Tuesday’s debate that saw Clinton and Sanders both perform well — and no other Democratic candidate registered above 1% support.
In the prior CNN/ORC poll, taken in mid-September, Clinton got 42%, compared to 24% for Sanders. In that poll, Biden got 22%.
SCOTT MORGAN/REUTERS Democratic presidential candidate Sen. Bernie Sanders saw a bump in popularity but still lags behind Clinton. A separate Monmouth University poll released Monday, however, showed Clinton building on her lead over the Vermont senator.
The Monmouth poll, also taken after the debate, found that Clinton got the support of 48% of registered Democrats nationally, compared to 21% for Sanders.
Those results marked a six-percentage-point jump for Clinton since the last Monmouth poll in September, when she got 42% support, and a statistically meaningless one-percentage-point increase for Sanders.
